results.title: A Communications primer
results.brief_description: This visually beautiful film was a first in a lot of ways: the Eameses’ first film scored by Elmer Bernstein, their first to deal with specific intellectual content, and the film that introduced their work to IBM. The elegant and clear statement remains essential viewing for the Media Age. The film deals with the ways in which human beings obtain their essential knowledge of the outside world. It has not always been recognised that communications consist of something more than the transmission of facts or symbols, and a mere facility for handling certain devices. What is required is an understanding of the human attributes and processes which control the passage of information from one person to another. The film will help discourage a limited view of communications. There are a number of philosophical implications, and some good illustrative samples on the concept of noise in a communication system, and provocative photographic symbolism about the power of words to add or detract to human knowledge. Music by Elmer Bernstein, sound by Barry Eddy.

results.title: Communications
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, C Fouty and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
Shows the need for effective communication in industry, not only in sales and production operations, but also in matters concerning the whole plant and its personnel. In the absence of authoritative information, rumours flourish sometimes causing serious tension among personnel, as illustrated in this film.

results.title: Communication case book
results.brief_description: Four case histories exploring an area of communication. The Case of the tuned-out mind: Communication is a two-way exchange in which the situation alters as each party responds to the other. The Case of the wrong wave-length: The ability to find and use the particular approach that will be most effective with each different individual. The Case of the chain-reaction: How we communicate is as important as what we communicate. The Case of the silent yell: Unspoken communication and its effect on goals and on our relationship with other people.

results.title: Communication by voice and action
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of gestures, expression, posture, voice and body movement in communication. Communication is a two way process between the speaker and the listener, so things must be said and done to clearly indicate the speaker’s thoughts and feelings.

results.title: Communicating with a group
results.creator_credit: John Krish and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Manager in Action”.
This film takes the form of a dramatised in-company training session on group communication. The film is designed to improve the abilities of people to communicate effectively with all groups. The special problems of communication with groups are identified.

results.title: Communicate to live
results.creator_credit: Ronnie Whitehouse, Sam Napier-Bell, Basic Films and Post Office Telecommunications
results.brief_description: Shows how communication is essential to a wide range of animal life, and gives a history of human communication and the possibilities for electronic communication in the future.

results.title: Commonwealth Review. No. 15
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine containing the following items: Fishing under the ice in Canadian lakes; The visit of the Malaysian Welfare Officers to a Government Rehabilitation Centre in Britain; a Nigerian organist at Cambridge University; a Trinidad textile designer in London; The training of the staff of Radio Uganda; Horse racing throughout the Commonwealth, showing the training of jockeys and their mounts.

results.title: Commonwealth Review. No. 14
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine containing the following items: The newest independent state of the Commonwealth, Malawi; The Centre of Educational Television Overseas in London; Paper making in New Zealand; The Karachi flower show; The work of two British girls who are members of Voluntary Service Overseas, in Rhodesia; Water-skiing without skis in Australia and ice-yachting in Canada.

results.title: Commonwealth Review. No. 12
results.brief_description: Cinemagzine containing the following items: Surfboard riding off the coast of Australia; Trout hatcheries in Western Australia; Copper mining in Northern Rhodesia; The manufacture of oil-filled cables in Britain; A British tractor designed for use in the paddy fields of Ceylon; A football match between Ministers and Diplomats in Tanganyika; The building of a Maori meeting house in New Zealand and carnival day in the West Indies.
